    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"

>
[Herbalist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6339) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=572" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 202 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Herbalist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=252)

**Prerequisites**
[Natural Medicine](/Feats.aspx?ID=5182); Trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)

</column>

---

You can create natural remedies. You gain the [advanced alchemy benefits](/Rules.aspx?ID=3282). You can use advanced alchemy to create 4 [alchemical](/Traits.aspx?ID=528) [consumables](/Traits.aspx?ID=564) with the [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) trait, though the number is reduced by 2 if you didn’t make your [daily preparations](/Rules.aspx?ID=2575) in the wilderness. These consumables are called your herbal items. You remember herbal item [formulas](/Rules.aspx?ID=2214) and don’t need a [formula book](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2724) for them.

You become an expert in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) and can use Nature instead of [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=37) to [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=2385) alchemical consumables with the healing trait. You don’t need to be trained in Crafting to do so, and you can use [healer’s tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2727) instead of [alchemist’s tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2702).

<title level="2">Herbalist Dedication leads to...</title>
[Advanced Herbalism](/Feats.aspx?ID=6342), [Endemic Herbs](/Feats.aspx?ID=6343), [Fresh Ingredients](/Feats.aspx?ID=6340), [Poultice Preparation](/Feats.aspx?ID=6341)
name: Herbalist Dedication
